comment.author: 96592826@N02
comment._content: Listed in the supplement to the Peoples Journal of 26 Sep 1925 'Our Glorious Dead'.  His address is given as 23½ Skene Square.  Born William Elrick Alexander to parents David and Jessie, his father was a saddler.  William is shown as a telegraph messenger in the 1911 census.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: On 25 Sep 1915 1st & 4th Battalion (Territorial Forces) Gordon Highlanders participated in the Second Attack on Bellewaarde (Hooge), an action that took place on the same day as the major offensive at Loos. www.4thgordons.com/2bellewaarde.html As per CWGC: Rank: Private Service No: 2983 Date of Death: 25/09/1915 Age: 19 Regiment/Service: Gordon Highlanders "C" Coy. 4th Bn Panel Reference Panel 38. Memorial YPRES (MENIN GATE) MEMORIAL www.cwgc.org/find-war-dead/casualty/925112/ALEXANDER,%20W... 1st Gordons diary (covers 4th Gordons) for Sep 1915 www.thegordonhighlanders.co.uk/Pages/Diary.htm#1915Sep
